intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. nummulariifolium, commonly known as the penny-cress or shieldflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features a basal rosette of lanceolate to spoon-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense heads, resembling a dandelion. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
